text: hello my needle drops Anthony Fantana
here Internet's busiest music nerd doing
an album review holy [ __ ] LAN now look
before I get too deep into this video I
know that usually I will edit myself or
put in a little if I swear but for the
sake of my sanity I'm not going to put
in a bleep every single time I say holy
[ __ ] because that's the band's name holy
[ __ ] is a Canadian band who I fell in
love with back in 2007 just like a lot
of people did with the release of their
LP LP and what made this album so
appealing to me at the time what makes
it appealing to me today is its
unbreakable grooves it's linear Dancy
structure its experimental electronics
its improvisation I wouldn't change a
thing about this album I mean it's like
sugar it hits the tongue it's
immediately good and it's a shock to the
system so of course since then I've been
awaiting a follow-up and now we have it
nine tracks 38 minutes and a noticeable
change since their last album even if
you don't like Len you can certainly not
accuse holy [ __ ] of making the same
album twice the most noticeable change
on this album is a real step up in
production
no more lo-fi or live sounds that we may
have heard on holy [ __ ] previous
efforts here the band really tries to
develop their studio sound with more
effects more clarity and a lot more
studio Sheen in that sense Latin is a
really mature album and it's noticeable
right from the beginning with the intro
track with the really huge reverb e
synthesizers that sound very very
Vangelis very huge epic ambitious and of
course after that you have the band's
usual combination of GRU
and electronics really crisp drums drum
machines these very spectral synthesized
sounds and a lot of those vocal yelps
that you may have heard on LP though
holy [ __ ] doesn't really have any lyrics
they do have some vocals from time to
time whether it be ooh or like oh and
you just sort of like hear it reading
across the mix there's definitely no
shortage of sonic texture among these
songs and there's a pretty decent mix on
a lot of these tracks too not really
sounding all that flat or
one-dimensional pretty panoramic at
times and there's a lot of variety on
this LP - I already mentioned that epic
opening then there's the tracks stay lit
which is one of the slowest but I think
is one of the most captivating - simply
because of its synth melody the tracks
know just kind of cashes in on the Kratt
rock influences that I always knew
holyfuck had but I just heard very
faintly in the background wasn't really
able to confirm them and then you have
some really fast or more aggressive
moments like stilettos - and I have to
be completely honest and there may be
some debate about this in the near
future but I don't really think this
album dethrones LP a lot of you may
remember that track review I did at the
song latin america off this album and
though it's not a bad song my one gripe
with it is that I felt a lot less
interplay between the band members on
that track I felt a lot less subtlety
and a lot less dynamics which is what
drew me to this band in the first place
a lot of the instruments on this LP
sound like they're conforming to a set
song structure if not recorded
individually as opposed to having the
band record these songs together all at
once whereas if you listen to LP even
multiple times it sounds like those
tracks could just break off in a
different direction at any moment
there's a lot of interplay there's a lot
of interaction between each musician a
lot of snap decision making I really
find this album to have the same
subtlety as any jazz quartet out there
I don't think Latin is going to send
people flying by the seat of their pants
like LP did when that album first
dropped
be honest but still Latin is a very fun
colorful album with a lot of dancey
qualities and great electronics it's
really catchy you're gonna get it in the
first listen but I think there's always
a reason to listen to this thing again
the Latin didn't amaze me holy [ __ ] is
SIL keeping things interesting and
they're most definitely evolving which I
like a lot
I'm feeling a decent seven on this thing
